definition: to complete a course of study (old)/to graduate
soldier/servant/to finish/to die/finally/at last/pawn in Chinese chess
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: Will your family be attending the graduation ceremony?
sentences.chinese: 你的家人要来参加你的卒业典礼吗？

sentences.english: I'll take your mom to the prom.
sentences.chinese: 我要带你妈妈去卒业舞会。

sentences.english: Both of his kids actually did graduate Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 他的两个孩子也的确从密歇根大学卒业。

sentences.english: After graduation, you will have to deal with the real world.
sentences.chinese: 本科卒业之后，你将必须面对这个真实的世界。

sentences.english: I hope you can return home after graduation, for the home-building efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我进展你能卒业后回国，为家乡建设出力。

definition: to stop halfway/to give up halfway/interruption/suspension
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
to give up work/to give up one's profession
(literary) to be in mourning after the death of a parent
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
